snippet: A federal judge ordered Ohio on Wednesday to restore the final three days of in-person, early voting in the swing state in a ruling that was a victory for Democrats.
abstract: Federal judge orders Ohio to restore final three days of in-person, early voting; ruling represents victory for Democrats who filed a lawsuit in 2012 over law that cut off in-person early voting for most residents three days before Election Day.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge ordered Ohio on Wednesday to restore the final three days of in-person, early voting in the swing state in a ruling that was a victory for Democrats.

headline.main: Ohio: Federal Judge Orders More Days for Early Voting
headline.print_headline: Ohio: Federal Judge Orders More Days for Early Voting
